title: Neil Wagner and Trent Boult bowl New Zealand to series win
description: The hosts needed only one extended session on day five to blast out the last seven Bangladesh wickets and wrap up victory by an innings and 12 runs

title: We have to bat with guts for longer periods - Mahmudullah
description: Mahmudullah admitted the batsman lacked a clarity of plan to counter Neil Wagner:s "bouncer theory"

title: Ross Taylor double-ton gives New Zealand a shot at victory
description: The hosts declared with a first-innings lead of 221, before taking three Bangladesh wickets in the last 23 overs of the day

title: Bangladesh cricketer Mosharraf Hossain diagnosed with brain tumour
description: The diagnosis, carried out a couple of days ago at a Dhaka hospital, revealed that the tumour is in its early stages

title: Bangladesh seek answers to NZ:s short-ball questions
description: While Bangladesh believe leaving the short ball alone might be the best way to deal with it, New Zealand:s Neil Wagner thinks that tactic plays to his strengths

title: Neil Wagner:s four-wicket haul highlights 12-wicket day
description: Tamim Iqbal, who scored 74, and Abu Jayed, who dismissed both New Zealand openers cheaply, ensured the match remained on an even keel

title: Incessant rain washes out second day:s play between New Zealand and Bangladesh too
description: There was likelihood of play for at least an hour in the evening session, but that was just the cue for another spell of rain

title: Rain washes out first day of second New Zealand-Bangladesh Test in Wellington
description: Play is scheduled to begin half an hour early on day two, but the forecast remains grim

title: Onus on Bangladesh quicks to step up as New Zealand eye series win
description: With a lethal pace attack and firepower in the batting, New Zealand have everything in place to wrap up the series in Wellington

title: Mushfiqur Rahim unlikely to be fit for second Test to stretch Bangladesh resources
description: Tamim Iqbal just had a light training session in Wellington after pulling up a little sore after his Hamilton efforts
